intro: Kaokochloa nigrirostris, commonly known as the black-billed lily, is a striking member of the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to the humid forests of western Africa, where it thrives in shaded, moist environments. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, showy white or pale purple flowers with a distinctive black-tipped spur. Its leaves are broad and lance-shaped, providing a lush backdrop to its floral display. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native range.
